intro: Touchiroa orientalis, commonly known as the oriental touchiroa, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features compound leaves with fine, feathery divisions and produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine. Touchiroa orientalis thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight.
